Life is winning in America thanks to the hard work and prayers of the pro-life movement for nearly 50 years. This year, the Supreme Court can protect the unborn by overturning a terrible injustice in the law. It’s time for Roe to go.
Our nation recognizes that all are created equal and all have the right to life. Today, Americans march in Washington to affirm that equality begins in the womb.
The right to life is the first, fundamental human right recognized in the Declaration of Independence. Right now, Americans are proclaiming this truth: that the right to life begins with the unborn.
Countless Americans are braving the cold today to March for Life. We pray for the marchers and for their courageous witness on behalf of the unborn.

There is no such thing as a “minor incursion.”

We must continue to provide Ukrainians with the resources they need to defend their country. https://t.co/qwvmOcVx3X

What matters is that Vladimir Putin heard our president say yesterday that he has the green light to invade Ukraine. https://t.co/CDw8JBS495
Joe Biden’s impotence emboldened Vladimir Putin and now he just green-lighted Putin to invade Ukraine.

I have warned President Biden for months to take action. His delay has diminished our capacity to help stop a Russian invasion. 

He must now take bold and firm action. He must not repeat his failure in Afghanistan.
https://t.co/1cFB31xX6V

When he ran for President, Joe Biden promised to respect our troops. Instead he launched a massive investigation and accused them of “extremism.” Did he lie or simply forget?
Our military is wasting precious time and resources on politically motivated investigations. They should be preparing to deter and defeat our nation’s enemies.
After months of fanatical searching, the Biden administration has found less than 100 “extremists” out of two million service members. They should be ashamed of this politically motivated witch hunt.
If the Pentagon wants to find extremists they should look to the Chinese Communist Party and Vladimir Putin’s Russia.

Today, we lift up Johnny in prayer. Our thoughts are with Dianne and the entire Isakson family and hope they find comfort and peace.

Senator Isakson was a great and kind man. He was a giant of the Senate and a statesman of uncommon humility. Johnny always saw and brought out the best in his colleagues. He is a friend who will be dearly missed.

20 years ago, China joined the WTO, marking the beginning of the Great Hollowing of our nation’s industrial base, economy, and working class. This was one of the greatest foreign policy mistakes in our nation’s history.

Bill Clinton once said that it was “ironic that so many Americans are concerned about the impact on the world of a strong China.” He was wrong, and the Americans he derided were right.
